intro:
Creator of the PupOS project.

Around the ZeroNet:
**tomascw@kaffie.bit**
**tomascw@cryptoid.bit**

post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
How do I backup my ZeroID?

Aside from being immune to censorship, I like Internet networks like ZeroNet because it's impossible for a website to go offline by conventional means. It's funny that America's current president, Trump, is so obsessed with Twitter but also so tech illiterate to realize how fragile the service really is by contrast to ZeroMe.

TPaw is a "company" on the Internet I own and founded on the clearnet (or normal Internet). The resources to keep it up make it rather have made it rather cumbersome or too much money that I don't have. A while back I spun off TPaw into TPaw Beyond for networks like this and now I'm serious about it - especially now that I backed up my ID. This is possibly the logo for Beyond.

I'm not a huge fan of copyright. Don't get me wrong. I understand ownership - my blog on ZeroNet is mine, not Wordpress or Blogger's. BUT copyright has been subject to so much abuse over the years and amplified on the Internet that I've decided to waive copyright of any my work because I can't be bothered. Just my two cents.
A less "noisy" version of the Beyond logo.
I have a really old website (circa. 2005/07) I made but never had a chance to host on the surface web that I've thought about migrating to ZeroNet.

[Furry Blue DOC](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NgWt4sQCugrit3JN3bTMHaeayTLGDrxnT/) was (and is again) an archive website of my old artwork from Summer to Autumn 2005. Winter and the following year was hard to recover since I kept jumping from computer to computer. It was initially on doc.furrybluedj.com (I think) then moved to a geocities archive for a while and finally here. 

I'm in the process of removing useless javascript and retrofitting the footer but everything remains untouched. It's literately just static html I made in Dreamweaver. So the website is a tad incomplete.

P2P really shines with messengers. Skype tends to lag sometimes and Discord, although designed for groups, is still annoying when it suffers an outage. AOL with AIM I can understand since that doubled as an ISP but that's the only exception I'm willing to let slide.
And the survey says... https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2017/05/cable-lobby-conducts-survey-finds-that-americans-want-net-neutrality/
Christ, can't escape Trumpsters bringing Obama or Clinton into the conversation for something that isn't even intended to be political.

Winter outfit: everything plus the kitchen sink. 
Summer outfit: underwear.
If you want to bootstrap your zite with it's first peer, use a proxy.
Oh! It would be smart if I revealed the ZeroNet website info pane so I could sign and publish Furry Blue DOC.
ZeroNet feels like AOL - in a good way - in that it has homegrown software which compliments it's features and help create a community. It's small but you don't feel alone.

ZeroNet and similar networks are actually they're own surface web when you think about it. Any site not indexed by search engines, such as RVRE or Kaffie, or not listed on sites like ZeroSites could be considered a section of that network's own "dark web."

I learned to curse in Swedish as part of my greater endeavor into teaching myself the language. "Fan" and "Helvete." Former is a syllable for "Hell" while the latter is the literal translation. I also found out what "Fitta" means "cunt" or "pussy" - pick your poison - both by accident and later confirmed as a usage as a common swearword for calling someone a "dick" - only female instead of male.
Omg! I just remembered an old train website I made years ago - early days of DSL - that I could bring to ZeroNet. Squee.
Da Ã¥t helvete, Comcast.

Booya! Found my favorite open source web designer: Blue Griffon. Never been so excited to get back into web design again.
http://bluegriffon.org

There is a bug in Mono 5.0 on Linux that causes TLS errors with Nuget on Monodevelop (via Flatpak). This workaround will solve the problem until it's properly fixed:
```export MONO_TLS_PROVIDER=legacy```

Initial release of the TPaw Beyond's new website has been published.
http://localhost:43110/1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84/
zero://1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84

A sketch of my fursona. He is - to put it bluntly - a cuntboy. 
Slightly mature content.

A sketch of my fursona's brother. He isn't a cuntboy.
Slightly mature content.
A more safe version of my fursona.

**Mature content**

The iRA, iRobot Autonomous, are a sentient robot species I've created. They drink oil to keep their joints from rusting and release it as you would expect it in a way as you would expect any species to do. They're male/female data ports between their legs that contain proprietary specifications based on the modifications of the standard software for use with reproducing. Voice, personality, ect... 

I've always wanted to experiment in creating my own species and I keep coming back to robots because it's such a fun concept. This is my *very* adult take on the concept - probably even more then Rick & Morty.

**Safe content**

 iRA clothed and with a livery.
Been a roller coaster of a week.

Me: "I fixed your README."
Dev: "This is not what I needed. It's not a real contribution."
Me: .... *unfollows, unwatches and unstars*
Omg! I finally remembered the word to describe why my robotic creatures need and release lubrication. Hydraulics.

**Possibly mature**
My iRA concept has really evolved.

"X community is cancerous!" 
"Y community is cancerous!" 
Ugh. Eventually they'll be no more minority communities left because they'll all be "cancerous!" Just stop giving the bad people the spotlight already.
So Mooch was fired within a shorter time frame then Michael Flynn. NEW RECORD!
This mobile update helps when you have two windows open side-by-side.
So I'm on Linux but need to reinstall Windows for a friend who uses Unity. Luckily, I backed up the entire ZeroNet ``data`` folder because I couldn't bother to figure out which site of mine is which.
Backing up the entire ``data`` directory was a good call. Made a seamless transition from Linux to Windows.
Trump wants to end the Russia story. He should start by not talking about it.
Sometimes I wonder if word documents in the future are all gonna be based on Markdown.
@Binchan :D
You know what would be cool for the ZeroHello site? A custom background.

Can't get anymore "state run" then this! http://www.snopes.com/2017/08/02/trump-administration-real-news/
Of course, there was a precursor to this. Sarabiesssss! https://youtu.be/YlTp-Rg-hug
Posting "Real News" show on Facebook is, like, North Korea putting KCTV (Korean Central Television) on Xfinity. xD

The pro-Trump Sinclair Broadcasting is trying to exploit local TV to push propaganda. However, cable cutting during the Obama era, Smart TVs and technology like Chromecast will likely hinder those efforts.
In non-political news, I'm learning Mozilla's Rust.

Sigh. I wanted to avoid talking about politics. Then North Korea has plans to strike Guam after Trump threatened them with "fire and fury." 

Boy, Trump picked one hell of a time to become president.

So...
- I know the basics of C#, though I was never really of a fan of the language. Long story.
- Started learning Rust because I need to know some bare metal language
- And now I'm learning Kotlin because I like it, gonna have a Native version, and it's basically become Android's Swift even if it was created by JetBeans. The latter all compliments itself since Android Studio is based off of the Intellij platform.

How Trump spent his Summer vacation
- Threatens nuclear war
- Threatens Venezuela
- Thanked Putin
- Charlottesville protests and murders

The sudden rise in Bitcoin's value is contributed to recent Bitcoin-related events, such as Segwit, combined and most likely the uncertainty in the dollar since America has yet to pass a proper spending bill under Trump. They're still stuck on who is going to pay for the wall.

So I managed to convince two friends of mine to use Bitcoin after I mentioned you're better off mining an alt-coin and exchanging that to Bitcoin. Another friend of mine suggested an CPU-based currency and that had me looking at Litecoin as a possible solution.

"We got Muslims out of the west." 
"Good job! They're still on earth, though. Have you tried something crazier? Like put them on Mars?"

So I've been debating Litecoin, Peercoin Vertcoin, as a alternative cryptocurrency. None of them! XD I went with Monero. And I've actually been able to mine something from my CPU! You have no idea how satisfying that feels.

I've been testing .NET Core 2.0 preview. It has a lot of promise. I'm gonna give C# another shot while I learn Kotlin on the side since I'm more familiar with the language. https://www.thurrott.com/dev/132897/microsoft-releases-net-core-2-0
Okay, so I kinda broke my blog.

Got an iPhone 5S from a friend I know in California. I have a soft spot for iOS even though Android is now my ideal mobile OS. I've been with iOS longer then Android - starting with the 1st generation iPod Touch. My love affair with Apple products is complicated.
And after almost two months away I'm finally back here and on Ubuntu again. I've gotten deeper into Kotlin and Android development. I've also started writing stories using Gitbook.
Trump is seriously calling for a crack down on the news. This is getting way out of hand.
Experimenting with Kotlin's Javascript compiler now too.

This was built using only KotlinJS and it's HTML DSL as an experiment. It isn't written safely yet even though there isn't anything there I'm aware of that could crash it. This is better than MVC.

[core.kt](https://github.com/tomascw/TomJS/blob/99b93a44d5190dc4781bbe6a697662c44bd98bf3/src/main/kotlin/core.kt) [main.kt](https://github.com/tomascw/TomJS/blob/99b93a44d5190dc4781bbe6a697662c44bd98bf3/src/main/kotlin/main.kt) [index.html](https://github.com/tomascw/TomJS/blob/99b93a44d5190dc4781bbe6a697662c44bd98bf3/web/index.html)

Trump: âI met with the president of the Virgin Islands.â

General Kelly introduces President Trump to the President of the US Virgin Islands by offering him a mirror.
O.M.G. Large downloads means ZeroNet-flavored Podcasts.

[Notes and Coins](http://localhost:43110/0sh.bit/?3uKM) on ZeroMedium.
Forgive the errors.
There was apparently a bug with my **Notes and Coins** 0short link. It should be fixed now, according to the developer.

Hopefully for Christmas I can get a small - Mac Mini-sized - computer with a beefy processor and decent amount of RAM that I can use for mining XMR. Finally be able to get some form of income since the situation where I live is not pretty from a financial persecutive. We had it better living back up north - even under the Bush era.
I got my first vinyl record! Touch by Eurythmics. I always wanted a record. Now I just need to get the turntable - which I've always wanted too. Apparently, they can last a long time.

Finally got myself two new IDs on ZeroNet:
``tomascw@kaffie.bit``
``tomascw@cryptoid.bit``

TPaw is going to remain a clear net thing. It's a long running web-based company that never evolved passed niche communities on existing centralized networks due to my lack of resources. And I've been thinking it's better to start fresh another name I've had up my sleeve for ZeroNet.
Work in progress using W3 CSS framework along side my own CSS. Logo is a filler from another template.

So I think I'll use Kotlin for client-side and mobile stuff and C# for servers since I really like ASP.NET. However, Bridge.NET, a C# to Javascript transcompiler, and KotlinJS are something I'm still messing around with since I haven't quite grasped the concept of web development in this fashion.

Finally got my Monero miner setup again. I originally used a strictly  Monero one but that had memory locking problems. So now I'm using a rather unmaintained but functional CryptoNote-based ``cpuminer``. I have it to set launch when my laptop boots until I get slightly more dedicated hardware.

Brought a bunch of books. A Swift cookbook by Packt, since part of me still has a soft spot for Apple, book on [Toki Pona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toki_Pona) (clearnet) - which I'm also gonna use a reference for building my own language, as well two books to help in developing stories.

Two languages I like: C# and Swift. Swift is clean, doesn't force OOP, and lacks a semicolon, but it makes more sense on macOS and Linux since it lacks support for Windows unless I decide commit to the Xamarin of Swift - RemObjects. Making it harder to justify for production use outside of the server world. C# is for all platforms at no cost but isn't nearly as clean, enforces OOP, and has a semicolon, but has reached a level maturity in ecosystem almost equal to that Java. Soo....

- Swift for playgrounds and pet projects
- C# for production and pet projects

Kotlin I'm gonna keep for Android.
Wow - Emercoin's blockchain downloaded pretty fast. So how hard would it be for ZeroNet to support it's domains too?
[Goodbye, Unity](https://godotengine.org/article/introducing-csharp-godot).
Actually, maybe I'll move my pet projects over to Kotlin. I want to learn it - I just need time to wrap my head around Java's fragmented package management.
Kotlin aside, I am, however, looking forward to Godot 3.0's upcoming alpha. I have big plans.
It is worth having two translation apps. Left: Microsoft, right: Google.

The GOP's double standards are sicking. At this rate, I'd rather just give the bad guys key to America, and move to Europe. To be honest, I feel more comfortable reading, writing or speaking Scandinavian  languages, let alone UK English, then I do US English. I just want to disown America.

I've mostly been on the clearnet as of late since it can be hard to keep track of ZeroNET all the time. I have been aggressively (though with breaks) studying Swedish both out of interest and for a friend who doesn't speak English well. I've also had to make one minor clearnet change that doesn't have some major effects - mostly in regards to Github. **On the clearnet**, I'm now _tomis_ instead of _tomes_. This is because it was a bitch to get tomascw as a username everywhere I wanted without pulling strings, like underscores or dashes, which I really want to try to avoid. So I decided to make a little comprise when I found out "tomis" is a legit spelling too. I remain TomasCW on here since I already got the name on ``Kaffie.bit`` and ``crytoid.bit``.

One time I told my dad, "English is, like, Chinese." To which he quickly disputed that claim. Turns out [I may be right on that claim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/English_orthography#Spelling_irregularities). (wiki, clearnet).

If I cannot bring you comfort
Then at least I bring you hope
For nothing is more precious
Than the time we have and so
We all must learn from small misfortune
Count the blessings that are real
Let the bells ring out for Christmas
At the closing of the year.
Just did a ``git push origin --force`` of one of my existing Git repositories hosted on Github to Git Center. I'm impressed at how painless it was.
Git Center, Torrent Share and now the completely automated Zirch. ZeroNet is really turning into a lovely decentralized alternative to the clearnet

Pocahontas predicted the likes of Trump. The name is immune from insult even when it's presented as one because it wasn't her real name. 

Clever. Now that is truly playing the long game.

I'll be uploading Linux/Unix distros, game patches, public domain and royalty free media to Torrent Share. Because I love the idea of finally having a decentralized torrent sharing site!

Legit torrent sites to upload torrents here:
- [Linux tracker](http://linuxtracker.org/index.php)
- [Game updates](http://www.gameupdates.org/)
- [Public domain torrents](http://www.publicdomaintorrents.info)
- [Internet Archive](https://archive.org)

Welp, that's my torrent dump for now. Was hoping to finish uploading Flash Gordon episodes but that got tedious doing it all individually. So I think I'll just use Archive.org for TV shows and serials next time since those are always in bulk. xD

Also next wave won't have "-" or "_" in the file names.

Bunch of game guides uploaded to [Torrent Share](/1ShArE1dJFcHFgTEEAUMXksDZuRckzd3Y/search.html?search=guide)! These come from Archive.org. If the Magnet link doesn't work, then just use the plain ol' ``.torrent``.
Because I'm a huge fan of The Sims, I figured I'd publish a copy [Sims2Pack Clean Installer](http://sims2pack.modthesims2.com/)'s source code onto [Git Center](/19CM81jc5cefjmWJp4ZJRpGaJZbSBYx2Ng).

So I'm working on my constructed language (i.e. a spoken language). It's simply known as "The Language" since it has no proper name now. It's inspired by Asian and North Germanic languages, as well as Toki Pana.
Git Center, you think it would be possible to delete repositories in a future update?

## Coffee with a Fennec
- [PupOS, an experiment in C# OS development](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:31)
- [The Golden Age of Radio](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:29)
The [PupOS](/17vnQapvrq5LNSFVXMmyXZoMtip38864AP) source code is now listed on the Git Center's repository index.
Now that I got  ``about``, ``help`` and catching unknown commands done, I can focus on trying to add in more complex elements. Because right now handling commands is limited to a switch statement.

## Coffee with a Fennec
- [PupOS Orion](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:32:PupOS+Orion)
I moved PupOS' logic code into a reusable shared project so I could create a terminal emulator for faster development of features that don't rely on the COSMOS framework to function.

I will never have to worry about loosing torrents from my [favorite](/1ShArE1dJFcHFgTEEAUMXksDZuRckzd3Y/search.html?search=project c) [DJs](/1ShArE1dJFcHFgTEEAUMXksDZuRckzd3Y/search.html?search=dj gt) EVER AGAIN. Thank you, ZeroNet & Torrent Share.
I keep wanting to call PupOS PawOS, and part of me is tempted to change it to that.

My constructed language, [Lanj](/1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84/lanj.html), finally has some legs on it. I had throw in a tone of research into the pronunciation of each letter in the language and how to properly represent it. I choose to go with [IPA](https://www.omniglot.com/writing/ipa.htm) (International Phonetic Alphabet) on the representation as oppose to doing something like "a as in ah," because the latter assumes the reader's first language is English. Now I can focus on the rest.
Starting to get into developing single page design. This will speed development up by a tone.

My websites based on the TPaw Core layout have been completely redesigned and now function as a single page thanks to a tiny, incy, little snippet code I found on the internet. It isn't perfect but it's what I've wanted for a long time.
[TPaw](/1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84) | [DOC](/1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84/doc.html)

## Coffee with a Fennec
- [TPaw Core 4.0](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:36:TPaw+Core+4.0)
- [Lanj](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:35:lanj)
The TPaw that I always wanted is coming together nicely.

If I cannot bring you comfort 
[Then at least I bring you hope](/1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84/index.html?p=closingofyear)
Moved the PupOS and lanj pages to [TPaw Lab](/1Aa8zGopvu58jHYDZaptW7tmmjBLmGeH84/lab.html).

TPaw is now works better then ever before. I've ditched the ``#[page]`` architecture, it suffered from always resetting with each refresh and couldn't be linked to directly. I've switched over to ``?=[page]`` which fixes these problems. :D

Part of me surprised at how simple the Javascript is.

Working on a dictionary (hopefully I'm using the right term) of words and their IPA pronunciation as well as English translation for my constructed language, Lenj. I decided to work on it because the book that shows how to use it had varies examples of words in a similar fashion throughout the course of it. I realized it would be easier if I had a list of existing list to choose from and then add those into the other book. The dictionary offers random list of the most common words in each category taken from wiktionary.
Friend's screenshot. Has anyone ever seen this before on Twitter?

> Shower Thoughts ð¿, [06.12.17 15:46]
> More people would stop texting while driving if we told them that they could be the killers instead of the killed.

> Shower Thoughts ð¿, [06.12.17 22:58]
> It's the time of year were multi-million dollar charities stand outside of multi-billion dollar businesses and ask people making minimum wage for money

TPaw just got a refresh to it's design. However, it also brought along with it a glaring bug - some pages are not showing suddenly. I'm looking into the fix. Right now DOC remains pretty much unaffected.
And after somewhat of an hiatus of me not looking forward to building a BASIC interrupter, PupOS finally got an update.
I finally got around to syncing my ZeroNet IDs on my Surface tablet with the ones from my laptop. My laptop has the Kaffie and CryptoID ids on it while my Surface still had my single ZeroID.

## Coffee with a Fennec/CryptoToÉ±is
* [CryptoToÉ±is](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:40:CryptoToÉ±is)

## CryptoToÉ±is
- [Mining, UBI and Jobs](\1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:43:Mining,+UBI+and+Jobs)
- [The story of Kit Welsh](\1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:42:The+story+of+Kit+Welsh) (off-topic)

Scraping a lot of my Sims-related work to focus on more original visual novels with Ren'Py. My heart keeps telling me, "just tell a story already." One of them is "What's New, Furry Blue?" Which, ironically, has the least original names since it was inspired by WB's "What's New, Scooby Doo?"

This game reuses and modifies my old assets from my Flash-based artwork I made from 2005 to 2007. Screenshot below is an early prototype. Final version will keep the Flash-based sprites but use backgrounds made in Krita.

## CryptoToÉ±is
- [Taxing cryptocurrencies](/1NKKKZ5gzyHEAR31Jg7JrMi2PxjBYcg2dH/?Post:45:Taxing+cryptocurrencies)

comment.body: @Sdfva: Thank you.
@Kaffie: I wish I could favorite replies.

@Kaffie: Actually, I've been pretty lenient on people's use of my work (and even characters) even before our money situation grew as bad as it did. My disgust of copyright really evolved from troubles surrounding YouTube daily.
@Kaffie: It's quite sad.
Huh. Note to self.
@ScrubTheSecond: ~~Hand dryer~~ Urinal out of order for a while.
@ScrubTheSecond: That looks like a hand dryer. So I do hope no one has urinated in it too. XD

@Patrick Jr.
I think that's just ZeroMe's compression. It's actually a PNG.
And added the link to my profile.
I have a love-hate relationship with GNU branded software.
@Jayofthezero: Thanks. XD

@Furiouspotato: That's actually where I learned those from. Expect Fitta. That was more of me messing with Google Keyboard and it accidentally translating one of the words into Fitta instead of what I really meant but Pewdiepie put some more context to it. xD

Tried to say that on Twitter the first time from my phone but the app didn't take kindly to it until I restarted it the second time. I have no idea what to make of it but roll it out as a coincidence.
Finally, I can get back to C# development.
@Kaffie: Noted. Their README _really_ needed fixing. Headers weren't properly formatted while requirements for the software happened to be enclosed in ``something like this`` due to spacing.

@æä¸ºäººäººï¼äººäººä¸ºæ: Thanks. It would take a lot of explaining to do. So I'll try my best. They're sentient robot creatures capable of reproducing. I created them for my fictional universes known as New & Zero Tales. They started out as robots that filled in space on a train but I couldn't pass up the opportunity to basically say what makes them them.
@Niba: Pretty much. All he ever does is complain.
@Jayofthezero: I see it used a lot to write and compile books and other documents so it often has me scratching my head.
@Jayofthezero: Gitbook uses Markdown to let people create and format ebooks. https://www.gitbook.com/
@Jayofthezero: I'm thinking more natively without extensions.
@Jayofthezero: Yeah, I know. It's some random thing I thought of considering how much it's been used over the years.
@Jayofthezero: Well, yeah. Just a suggestion is all.
@Jayofthezero: Oh my god, tell me about it. It's not like we don't already have enough politics to do with just with him tweeting.
@Antyhrabia: I just associate it with Mozilla since it was started by a employee of there's and their promotion of it.
@æä¸ºäººäººï¼äººäººä¸ºæ: No one has been able to control Trump.
@Maoxian: No. CPU works too.
@ulrichard: That might be a little too old school. xD

@Krixano: I actually have both books that I need to catch up on again. Toki Pona is language I'm both interested in but also wanna use the book as a reference for building documentation for my own language.

@Krixano: Rust is never far from my radar. It's a language I'm still experimenting with in order to get the feel of since it does do somethings differently. It'll likely replace Swift in the not to distant future.
@ulrichard @Krixano: C++ is language I'm learning more for the trade then for my own projects.
@Jayofthezero: Neither truly are. In the end, it comes down to what you think is the right one.
@Binchan: Oh.... Thank you. Wish ZeroMe could heart replies.
@Git Center: [The Train](http://localhost:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1CxCeuVN2K2968qB4KPzUCBaUAXEnDCcN7). No secret, just isn't ready for prime.
@Git Center: I'll keep that in mind.
@Git Center: Oh! My bad. Kinda missed that part.
@Binchan: Thank you. :D
@Git Center: I was thinking more like from "my repos," but the index would be nice too.

P.S. If you want to help upload all of these, bulk download: ``wget --no-clobber --convert-links --random-wait -r -p -E -e robots=off -U mozilla http://tracker.generationtrance.com/torrents/``.
Should work for other trackers too.
The TPaw website should load hell of a lot quicker now!
@Binchan: My bad, and thanks!
